014package org.jdbi.v3.core.interceptor;
015
016import java.util.Iterator;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
019import java.util.function.Function;
020
021import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
022import javax.annotation.Nullable;
023
024import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Alpha;
025
026import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
027
028/**
029 * An interception chain holder to manage transformation operations.
030 *
031 * @param <S> Type of the transformation source.
032 * @param <T> Type of the transformation target.
033 */
034@Alpha
035public final class JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<S, T> {
036
037    @SuppressWarnings("UnnecessaryLambda") // constant for readablity
038    private static final Function<?, ?> DEFAULT_TRANSFORMER = source -> {
039        if (source == null) {
040            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("null value is not supported");
041        } else {
042            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("object type '" + source.getClass().getSimpleName() + "' is not supported");
043        }
044    };
045
046    private final List<JdbiInterceptor<S, T>> interceptors = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
047    private Function<S, T> defaultTransformer;
048
049    /**
050     * Creates a new chain holder with a default interceptor.
051     *
052     * @param defaultTransformer A default interceptor that is used when no other registered interceptor processes a source object. Must not be null.
053     */
054    public JdbiInterceptionChainHolder(Function<S, T> defaultTransformer) {
055        this.defaultTransformer = requireNonNull(defaultTransformer, "defaultTransformer is null");
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Creates a new chain holder. Throws {@link UnsupportedOperationException} if no registered interceptor processes a source object.
060     */
061    public JdbiInterceptionChainHolder() {
062        this.defaultTransformer = (Function<S, T>) DEFAULT_TRANSFORMER;
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Processes a source object and returns a target object.
067     *
068     * @param source A source object.
069     * @return A target object processed by one of the registered {@link JdbiInterceptor} instances.
070     */
071    @Nonnull
072    public T process(@Nullable S source) {
073        ChainInstance instance = new ChainInstance(source);
074        T result = instance.next();
075        requireNonNull(result, "chain returned null value for '" + source + "'");
076        return result;
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Registers a new interceptor at the beginning of the chain. Any subsequent call to {@link #process(Object)} will use this interceptor before all other
081     * already registered interceptors.
082     *
083     * @param interceptor An object implementing {@link JdbiInterceptor}.
084     */
085    public void addFirst(JdbiInterceptor<S, T> interceptor) {
086        requireNonNull(interceptor, "interceptor is null");
087
088        interceptors.add(0, interceptor);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Registers a new interceptor at the end of the chain. Any subsequent call to {@link #process(Object)} will use this interceptor after all other already
093     * registered interceptors.
094     *
095     * @param interceptor An object implementing {@link JdbiInterceptor}.
096     */
097    public void addLast(JdbiInterceptor<S, T> interceptor) {
098        requireNonNull(interceptor, "interceptor is null");
099
100        interceptors.add(interceptor);
101    }
102
103    public void copy(JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<S, T> chainHolder) {
104        requireNonNull(chainHolder, "chainHolder is null");
105        interceptors.clear();
106        interceptors.addAll(chainHolder.interceptors);
107        defaultTransformer = chainHolder.defaultTransformer;
108    }
109
110    final class ChainInstance implements JdbiInterceptionChain<T> {
111
112        private final Iterator<JdbiInterceptor<S, T>> iterator;
113        private final S source;
114
115        ChainInstance(S source) {
116            this.source = source;
117            this.iterator = interceptors.iterator();
118        }
119
120        @Override
121        public T next() {
122            if (iterator.hasNext()) {
123                JdbiInterceptor<S, T> interceptor = iterator.next();
124                return interceptor.intercept(source, this);
125            } else {
126                return defaultTransformer.apply(source);
127            }
128        }
129    }
130}
